title: Famous People: Literature (Usefulness 1-5)
description: Traveler usefulness 1-5/10 phrases for the Literature subcategory within Famous People. Includes 5 card(s).

cards.english: Ichiyo Higuchi is the first woman whose likeness was printed on banknotes.
cards.romaji: Higuchi Ichiy wa, josei toshite hajimete osatsu no sh z ni narimashita.
cards.japanese: 樋口一葉は、女性として初めてお札の肖像になりました。

cards.english: Almost all Japanese people have read Yasunari Kawabata's novels "Snow Country" and "the Dancing Girl of Izu".
cards.romaji: nihonjin no hotondo no hito wa Kawabata Yasunari no "Yukiguni" ya "Izu no Odoriko" o yonda kotoga arimasu.
cards.japanese: 日本人のほとんどの人は川端康成の「雪国」や「伊豆の踊子」を読んだことがあります。

cards.english: Lady Murasaki is best known for her long story "The Tale of Genji".
cards.romaji: Murasakishikibu wa, "genji monogatari" de yoku shirarete imasu.
cards.japanese: 紫式部は、「源氏物語」でよく知られています。

cards.english: Haruki Murakami's novel Norwegian Wood triggered the "Murakami boom", with total sales of 4.5 million copies.
cards.romaji: Haruki Murakami no "Noruwei no mori" wa yonsen gohyakuman bu o uriage, "Murakami b.mu" no kikkake to natta.
cards.japanese: 村上春樹の「ノルウェイの森」は四千五百万部を売り上げ、「村上ブーム」のきっかけとなった。

cards.english: The Silent Cry is one of Kenzaburo Oe's best known works.
cards.romaji: Man'nen gan'nen no futtob r. wa, .e Kenzabur no daihy saku desu.
cards.japanese: 「万延元年のフットボール」は、大江健三郎の代表作です。
